docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y, Aug. 6 -- Arthur J. Goldberg conferred for more than an hour today on the Vietnam crisis with the six elected members of the Security Council without any suggestion from any participant for a solution.

headline.main: GOLDBERG CONFERS HERE ON VIETNAM; Sees U.N. Delegates of Six Elected Council Members

docs.snippet: Four United States naval vessels and two patrol aircraft will leave their home ports along the Atlantic tomorrow to begin a four-month good will cruise and antisubmarine exercises with eight South American nations.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 8 -- Argentina and Brazil were reported today to have offered to use all available resources and their international influence to help their smaller neighbor, Uruguay, to overcome her acute financial and economic crisis.

docs.snippet: A REQUIEM from a contemporary Soviet composer seems unlikely. Yet the Eastman School of Music of the University of Rochester recently announced that it would give a work with this title by Dmitri Kabalevsky on Dec. 16.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 14 -- The President of Uruguay's nine-man ruling council, Dr. Washington Beltran told the Argentine Government today that until Latin-American countries agreed on common trade and foreign policies it was futile to talk about...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 14 -- The President of Uruguay's nine-man ruling council, Dr. Washington Beltran told the Argentine Government today that until Latin-American countries agreed on common trade and foreign policies it was futile to talk about forming new institutions such as an inter-American peace force.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 16 -- A high-level United States mission that recently visited Brazil has caused surprise and some uneasiness in several South American capitals.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 16 -- A high-level United States mission that recently visited Brazil has caused surprise and some uneasiness in several South American capitals.
docs.abstract: Latin Amers fear US may be strengthening ties with Brazil at expense of other nations; cite Sen Fulbright statements hailing Brazil as dominant Latin-Amer nation and Under Sec Mann demand that other countries make greater internal effort to get US aid; deplore fact that 1st high-level mission of Johnson Adm visited Brazil only

headline.main: Comments by Fulbright and Mann Cause Some Latin Dismay
